result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MARY L BOSTAD

records.addlTxt:
1:39 PM Defendant MARY L BOSTAD in court.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq in court for MARY L BOSTAD.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF144 & 2020CF52. 2022CF144-Atty Snow confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Atty Snow states the defendant will waive the prelim. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. Court will set for Arraignment on November 22, 2022 at 1:15 PM..

2020CF52 - Court adjourns Motion hearing to November 22, 2022 at 1:15 PM.

Court adjourned at 1:41 PM
Initial appearance on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Todd Snow dated 09/06/2022 re: missed court appearance

Amount: $20.00

9:43 AM Defendant MARY L BOSTAD not in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court orders a warrant - forthwith.

Court adjourned at 9:43 AM
